title: Business Live: House approves biggest tax cuts in 30 years - BBC News
summary: toys r us uk jobs under threat .

documents.title: goodnight
text: all good things must come to an end , and that 's it from us for tonight .
but do n't fear - we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 on wednesday with all the latest business news .
do join us then .

documents.title: wall street closes slightly lower
text: us shares ended slightly lower as the us house of representatives approved a long-anticipated tax cut bill .
the dow jones industrial average has ended the day down 0.15 % or 37.5 points to 24,754.75 .
the top loser was goldman saches , down 1.25 % to $ 256.78 .
the broader s & p 500 meanwhile closed lower , falling 0.32 % or 8.7 points to 2,681.47 .
the top faller was ppl corp , down 4.6 % to $ 32.42 on news that the farmers national bank decreased its stake in the firm by 17 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq ended down 0.44 % or 30.9 points to 6,963.85 , dragged down by novavax inc , down 17 % to $ 1.24 after a wall street analyst downgraded its stock from buy to neutral .

documents.title: mystery donors contribute £ 4.5m of stand redevelopment costs
text: hearts owner ann budge says an anonymous benefactor has contributed £ 4.5m towards the building of the new tynecastle main stand
gaz from falkirk the septic fan
the union bears

documents.title: pension funds 'at the front of the queue '
text: frank field , chair of the work and pensions committee , has told bbc 5 live drive that pension funds should be at the front of the queue ahead of other creditors when companies go into administration .
in addition , there is something the pension protection fund ( ppf ) can do to protect toys r us uk employees .

where it looks as though monies have been moved around to the advantage of individuals or to companies abroad where the present workforce and the pension fund has been disadvantaged , '' said mr field .

`` then we need to have the pension protection fund to have new powers so that it can claw back where possible monies which have been , in what the man and woman in the street would have thought , is a misappropriation of company funds . ''

documents.title: what do you think of disney 's donald trump robot ?
text: what do you think of disney 's donald trump robot ?

documents.title: tax bill 'great ' for small and medium-sized businesses
text: brian perry , portfolio manager at hennessy funds in novato , california , says that the republicans ' tax cut plan will be positive for smaller businesses .
`` looking at companies in our portfolio , [ the tax bill ] will be great for domestic small- and mid-cap companies paying a 30 % , 35 % effective tax rate , '' he said .
`` a lot of them do not have the ability to move profits offshore i 'll wait and see how much , but i can see another 5 % rise [ in the market ] in the next few months as the tax bill kicks in . ''

documents.title: no certainty on economic growth
text: according to paul nolte , portfolio manager at kingsview asset management in chicago , it was expected that the republicans ' tax reform bill would make it past the house of representatives .
`` it 's pretty much along party lines , '' he said .
`` it 's going to take time to see how the general population reacts to it .
the expectation is companies are going to bring back a lot of dollars back to the united states and put it into plant and equipment .
it very well may go into stock buybacks and dividend increases .
`` there 's no certainty we 're going to get the promised economic gain everybody 's been talking about . ''

documents.title: house approves biggest tax overhaul in 30 years
text: the us house of representatives has approved the biggest tax overhaul plan in 30 years .
the bill passed the house by a vote of 227 to 203 .
businesses will see permanent steep tax cuts , while some individuals and families will receive temporary cuts .

middle income households would see an average tax cut of $ 900 next year , while the wealthiest 1 % of americans would see an average cut of $ 51,000 , according to the nonpartisan think tank tax policy center .
the republicans say that the new legislation will boost economic growth - the move will add $ 1.5 trillion to national debt .
the bill also repeals a section of the obamacare health system , and allows for oil drilling in alaska 's arctic national wildlife refuge .

documents.title: saudi arabia 2018 budget 'a success '
text: saudi arabia 's crown prince mohammed bin salman says that the 2018 budget will have the largest state spending in the kingdom 's history .
he says this is evidence of success despite low oil prices , and that improving living standards for saudi citizens was a government priority , according to comments on the state news agency spa .

documents.title: universal and youtube strike a deal
text: youtube has agreed to pay more to universal in exchange for its copyrights , in a new long term licensing agreement .
the deal has taken over two years to agree and means universal artists will get more money when their songs are played on the site .

sir lucian grainge , chairman and chief executive of universal , said the deal would provide growing compensation from youtube 's ad-supported and paid-subscription tiers , while also furthering youtube 's commitment to manage music rights on its platform . ''
earlier this year , universal secured a deal to give it exclusive licensing rights to much of the late musician prince 's private archive .

documents.title: one of the world 's oldest erotic novels pulled from auction
text: the french government has pulled one of the world 's earliest and most sordid erotic novels from auction , declaring that it is a national treasure .
`` 120 days of sodom '' was written by the marquis de sade in 1785 while he was imprisoned in the bastilee on 33 pieces of scroll .
de sade was a nobleman , politician , philosopher and writer best known for his libertine sexuality .
the book , considered to be his most obscene work , had attracted interest from foreign buyers and had been expected to fetch between €4-6m at auction , according to french auctioneers aguttes .
by declaring the book a `` national treasure '' , the french state has 30 months to raise funds to purchase the book , or it will be put back on sale .

documents.title: crypto company trading suspended in us
text: trading in the shares of crypto company has been suspended until 3 january .
the small us firm has seens its shares rise more than 2,700 % this month after signing a deal to buy a crypto currency data platform .
the us securities and exchange commission said it was concerned about the `` accuracy and adequacy of information '' available to investors .
it said there were also questions concerning `` potentially manipulative transactions '' in the company 's stock in november .
crypto company says it provides a `` portfolio of digital assets , technologies , and consulting services to the blockchain and crypto currency markets . ''

documents.title: emissions fix approved for audi diesel vehicles
text: us regulators have approved an emissions fix for 24,000 audi 3-litre passengers cars , including all 2014 to 2016 audi a6 quattro , a7 quattro , a8 , a8l and q5 diesel vehicles .
the fix requires volkswagen to remove defeat device software that reduced emission control effectiveness and replacing certain hardware components .
to date , approval for fixes has been granted to over 75 % of 3-litre diesel automobiles , according to the car manufacturer .

documents.title: when is the best time to look for a job ?
text: when is the best time to look for a job ?
we found out .

documents.title: facebook and microsoft disabled cyber threats from north korea
text: a senior white house official says that facebook and microsoft recently acted to disable a number of potential north korean cyber threats .

`` facebook took down accounts and stopped the operational execution of ongoing cyber attacks and microsoft acted to patch existing attacks , not just the wannacry attack initially , '' white house homeland security adviser tom bossert said on tuesday .
he added that the us government had clear evidence that north korea was responsible for the attack , though he did not give details .

documents.title: steinhoff shares tank
text: german-listed shares in steinhoff , the south african owner of poundland fell by over 20.5 % after it revealed that lenders are starting to withdraw or suspend credit following allegations of accounting irregularities .

in a presentation prepared for a crunch meeting with lenders , the company said that given the ongoing forensic review , it was not possible to give further details regarding the `` magnitude of the accounting irregularities that are under scrutiny '' .
`` the recent announcements have had a destabilising effect on the group that will need to be addressed in order to preserve value for all stakeholders , '' the company said in its presentation .

`` continuing support from the group 's creditors and other stakeholders will be required to maintain stability and to provide the required time to address the current issues and preserve value for all stakeholders . ''

documents.title: london ends slightly ahead
text: the ftse 100 has closed up 0.09 % or 7.1 points at 7,544.09 , still supported by a weaker pound .
the index was led by shire plc , up 3.7 % to £ 39.15 , despite the fact that its experimental drug for children with hunter syndrome failed to meet late-stage clinical trial goals .
the biggest loser was international private healthcare provider mediclinic international , down 4.9 % to 578p .
meanwhile , the ftse 250 ended up 0.43 % or 86.1 points to 20,341.51 .
cybersecurity firm sophos group led the winners , up 5.2 % to 569p after announcing a positive earnings update .
top of the losers was udg healthcare plc , down 5.9 % to 842p .

documents.title: banks late with data 'revolution '
text: five of the nine banks ordered to be ready for a banking `` revolution '' by mid-january will miss the deadline .
the banks have been given extra time to be fully set up for open banking , a system allowing customers to use their payment history to get better deals .
five out of nine banks to miss # openbanking deadline set by @ twitterid some customers to wait an extra year

documents.title: tci not backing down
text: unhappy shareholder tci fund management is not backing down , despite the fact that london stock exchange chairman donald brydon won the backing of 79 % of shareholders .
`` 21 % of voting shareholders elected to remove donald brydon as a director of the london stock exchange group , '' sir christopher hohn wrote in a letter .
`` additionally , many of the large shareholders who voted against the resolution have informed us that they had asked the board to commence work on the chairman 's succession plan immediately .
`` the vote constitutes a serious rebuke of the board by shareholders a chairman of a major ftse 100 company is expected to command the overwhelming support of shareholders .
`` this is no longer the case with lseg and it is therefore imperative that a search begins immediately for a new chairman as there is no justification for waiting until 2019 . ''

documents.title: what happens if toys r us goes out of business ?
text: so what happens if toys r us goes out of business in the uk ?
according to a report submitted to the high court of justice , british taxpayers will lose £ 12,417,660 if the troubled toy store chain goes out of business .
that figure is made up of : £ 7,959,681 to local authorities in tax ; £ 2,187,644 to local authorities which own their properties , and £ 2,270,335 to the hmrc .
toys r us ' biggest creditor is hasbro - it owes the toymaker £ 8.5m , followed by lego , which is owed £ 3.6m .

documents.title: uk government queries toys r us executive pay-outs
text: the work & pensions committee says it has asked toys r us 's uk managing director steve knights to explain why there have been massive increases in pay-outs made to the former uk head of the company roger mclaughlan .
it has been reported in the media that payments to mr mclaughlan increased from £ 356,000 in 2014 to £ 1m in 2015 , and then to £ 1.3m in 2016 .
the pay-outs were made over the last two years , during a period of substantial operating losses leading up to the current proposals to close 26 stores in the uk .

documents.title: ryanair hints will extend union recognition
text: ryanair has hinted it will recognise cabin crew unions for the first time .
meetings will be held in `` due course '' .
the airline is meeting a pilots ' union for the first time in its 32-year history on tuesday .

a statement said : `` as ryanair 's statement of friday december 15 made clear , ryanair is moving to recognise unions , starting this week with meetings with irish , german and portuguese pilot unions .
it went on to say : `` it will lead on in the new year to meetings with other eu pilot unions and cabin crew unions in due course as well . ''

documents.title: wall street down on open
text: us shares fell at open on tuesday , despite rising hopes that the us congress will vote in favour of the republicans ' proposed tax overhaul plans .
the dow jones is down 0.16 % or 40.6 points to 24,751.65 , weighed down by microsoft , which has fallen 0.6 % to $ 85.86 .
the s & p 500 is down 0.11 % or 2.8 points to 2,687.32 .
the biggest loser was ppl corp , down 3 % to $ 32.95 on news that the farmers national bank decreased its stake in the firm by 17 % .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has fallen 0.27 % or 18.8 points to 6,976.00 , dragged down by novavax inc , down 17 % to $ 1.24 after a wall street analyst downgraded its stock from buy to neutral .

documents.title: send a text to end your mobile contract
text: mobile phone users will soon be able to switch providers by sending a text to the operator they want to leave , the telecoms regulator has confirmed .
ofcom said the change meant customers could avoid a long call to their operator when they want to switch .
in turn , they will be sent switching codes to pass on to their new provider .

documents.title: stability welcome
text: commenting on the result of the lse 's general meeting , chairman donald brydon said : `` the board would like to thank shareholders for their support today .
`` the board and i welcome the stability that this gives the group .

`` the recruitment process for a new ceo is under way and we will update our shareholders in due course , '' he said , referring to the search for a replace for a replacement for former chief executive xavier rolet , who stepped down last month .

documents.title: breakinglse chairman wins vote
text: the chairman of the london stock exchange , donald brydon , has won the backing of the majority of shareholders .
an extraordinary general meeting held earlier on tuesday resulted in the backing of 79 % of shareholders .

hedge fund , tci fund management , a 5 % shareholder in lse , had pressed to get rid of mr brydon amid unhappiness over the departure of xavier rolet , the group 's former chief executive , who left last month , a year earlier than planned .

documents.title: breakingppf to vote against toys r us restructuring plan
text: the pension protection fund ( ppf ) has announced that it intends to vote against toys r us ' proposed company voluntary agreement ( cva ) .

`` since the company lodged the cva proposals we have spent significant time and effort , with the help of pwc , assessing the current and future financial position of the company to ensure the pension scheme would not be weakened by the cva , leading to an even bigger claim on the ppf and its levy payers further down the line , '' said malcolm weir , ppf 's director of restructuring and insolvency .

given the position of the company , we strongly believe seeking assurances for the pension scheme is reasonable given the deficit in the scheme and questions about the overall position of the company .
we remain in dialogue with the company and their advisors and we are able to amend our vote if suitable assurances provided . ''

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks to dearbail and rebecca for this morning 's live coverage of all things business .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views from britain and beyond .
got a point of view ?
tweet me at @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: us current account deficit falls
text: the us current account deficit shrank by more than expected , official figures show .
the commerce department said the current account deficit , which measures the flow of goods , services and investments into and out of the country , dropped 19 % in the third quarter to $ 100bn .
that was the lowest level since the third quarter of 2014 .

documents.title: lse 'brought opprobrium ' says shareholder
text: the meeting on the future of the chairman of the london stock exchange heard the board accused on tuesday of `` bringing opprobium '' on the 300-year old exchange .

activist shareholder tci brought a resolution to the extraordinary general meeting calling for lse chairman donald brydon to be fired over his handling of the departure of former chief executive , xavier rolet , who left in november , a year earlier than planned .
`` this is a very sorry affair , which has brough considerable opprobium on the company , '' aubrey franklin , a small shareholder for over 20 years who backed the resolution , told the meeting .
the tci resolution is expected to be defeated after major shareholders indicated they would vote against it .
the result will be published later on tuesday .

documents.title: port talbot pension transfers under scrutiny
text: the regulator the financial conduct authority has been investigating 17 companies after tata employees said they got bad advice about moving from the british steel pension scheme .
some firms have been accused of preying on pensioners , some of whom have substantial pension pots .
advisers can earn thousands in commission for bringing new clients to investment firms .

darren reynolds , the director of active wealth ( uk ) ltd , and clive howells , managing director of another firm , celtic wealth management , who failed to attend last week 's hearing on the british steel pension , have now been written to by the work and pensions committee .

documents.title: mobiles dominate free time
text: the office for national statistics wonders whether smartphones and the like are making youngsters less sociable ?
business live would suggest asking a teenager but fears it would only get a sullen grunt in reply .
are mobile devices making young people less sociable ?
sad emoji .

documents.title: yemen crisis spikes vimto sales
text: bad news for fans of vimto in the middle east .
nichols , which makes the purple cordial , says : `` the recent escalation of hostilities in yemen has resulted in the supply route to our yemeni customer being blockaded .
`` therefore , at this time we are unable to send any further vimto concentrate shipments that were planned for december 2017 . ''
it says it now expects adjusted pre-tax profit for the year to be in line with 2016 .

documents.title: basic bank account numbers rise
text: the number of people with basic , fee-free bank accounts is rising .
the uk treasury says more than 900,000 new bank accounts were opened between july 2016 and june 2017 , and for the second year running nationwide and lloyds banking group opened the most .

documents.title: passing the mantle
text: music producer trevor horn has paid tribute to jill sinclair , who was instrumental in the success of ztt , the record label behind frankie goes to hollywood , and publisher perfect songs which , along with stiff records , has been sold to universal .
`` jill started perfect songs and ztt in the 80 's and i 'm extremely proud of what she achieved , '' he said of his late wife .
he added : `` i 'd like to thank all the writers and the artists on ztt , perfect and stiff .
`` it was a great experience and i enjoyed working with each one of you ( most of the time ) . ''

documents.title: uber drivers 'forced to work exhausting hours '
text: uber is a danger to public safety because it forces drivers to work exhausting hours just to make ends meet , a union has told a court .
the gmb union has mounted legal efforts to become a participant in the taxi-hailing firm 's appeal against a decision not to renew its licence in london .
a spokesperson for uber said : `` drivers spend an average of 30 hours a week logged into our app .
`` however , this is not the same as the number of hours spent driving since drivers can log in while on a break or doing other things .
`` we take the issue of tired driving seriously , which is why we regularly remind drivers to take rest breaks and will shortly be introducing hours limits in our app . ''

documents.title: test your bank knowledge
text: you do n't have to be a total egghead to do well in the bank of england 's annual christmas quiz but it helps .
the # bankunderground christmas quiz !
pit your wits against ten fiendishly festive questions on all things central banking

here is a quiz for boe & carney : if inflation is 3.5 % up from close to 0 and current interest rates are maintained near minimum as a governor of a central bank what would you do : a ) raise rates b ) lower rates c ) write a letter ?
historical questions you either know the answer or not , not really very informative .
how about q .
who owns the dosh in your bank account ?
hint , it 's not you .

documents.title: former steinhoff business partner files lawsuits
text: as steinhoff investors meet to try and thrash out a deal with the south african company 's bankers , it is facing legal action from a former business partner , according to bloomberg .
it reports that andreas seifert has filed lawsuits against steinhoff , owner of poundland , bensons and harveys , in germany , the netherlands and his homeland of austria .
for full details on the scandal surrounding steinhoff , click here .

documents.title: toys r us troubles in tweetsbbc personal finance correspondent simon gompertz writes :
text: the toy retailer plans to shut 26 out of 105 shops , and shed 800 staff under the plan - but the pension protection fund ( ppf ) could block the cva
i think the ppf is minded to vote against and will say so , putting a further question mark over company 's future and leading to more frenzied talks
toys `` r '' us is facing the full heat of the internet shopping revolution .
it hopes to struggle on under an insolvency process called a cva , which needs 75 % support from creditors
they 've been facing that heat for at least a good decade now .
just lived in denial .
finally have been hit by a good dose of reality .
the ppf speaks for toys `` r '' us pension scheme members .
the fund is £ 25m to £ 30m in deficit .
it needs around £ 100m to pay pensions but only has around £ 70m
the ppf has a deciding vote when creditors meet to decide on the cva on thursday .
it wants £ 9m more for the fund , effectively 3 years of contributions , paid in advance

documents.title: text-to-switch plan confirmed
text: regulator ofcom has confirmed a plan to allow mobile phone users to switch operators by sending a text to the provider they want to leave .
ofcom said customers could avoid an awkward and long call to their operator and instead send a text .
in turn , they will be sent switching codes to pass on to their new provider .
the new system will come into force in may 2019 .
the regulator 's previously preferred option - a more simple one-stage process - was dropped earlier this year .
ofcom said that the new system allowed customers to haggle with their existing provider for a cheaper price should they wish to .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: careful where you buy your stamps
text: did you know that the price of a stamp varies , according to where you buy it ?
some corner shops - and some sellers on amazon - are charging a third more than if you buy your stamps through the royal mail .
personal finance blogger andy webb found one corner shop charging 75p each for second class stamps , when they should cost only 56p .
another charged 90p for first class stamps , which should cost 65p .
that 's 38 % above the face value .
one retailer on amazon advertised a '' 39 % discount '' on first class stamps ; an odd statement to make when it is selling them for 81.5p each .
royal mail said retailers who had acquired stamps through them were obliged to sell at the same , or a lower price .
however if they have bought them elsewhere , they are under no obligation to sell them at face value .
author: Brian Milligan
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: will trump 's plans trigger a tax war ?
text: will trump 's plans trigger a tax war ?
author: Natalie Sherman
Business reporter, New York

documents.title: feather & black stores saved
text: the majority of staff at furniture and bedding chain feather & black kept their jobs after hilding anders international bought 17 out of a total of 20 stores .
administrators duff and phelps say 104 of the 123 employees at the business will retain their roles .
the feather & black brand , founded in 2005 , will be retained .

documents.title: breakingsteinhoff looks inside for new boss
text: steinhoff , the south african owner of poundland , has appointed daniel van der merwe as its new chief executive .
mr van der merwe was chief operating officer at the group .
steinhoff has also added alexandre nodale and louis du preez to the board .
mr nodale will become deputy chief executive and remain in charge of conforama , a subsidiary of steinhoff .
mr du preez is appointed as commercial director and is described as `` an experienced qualified attorney , specialising in corporate and commercial matters '' .
steinhoff 's previous chief executive markus jooste recently resigned following the discovery of accounting irregularities .

documents.title: energy hearing - 'market is competitive '
text: stephen forbes , chief commercial officer of sse ( scottish and southern ) tells the hearing there are now 60 suppliers in the market - a far more competitive market than in the recent past .
he says this shows competition is working .

documents.title: 'a fair return '
text: stephen forbes , chief commercial officer at sse , is defending the industry to mps .
he says on average the firm has made a 5.9 % profit over the past five years .
`` it 's a fair return for what we do , '' he says .
pushed on the discrepancy between what customers on the standard variable rate pay compared to customers on other tariffs , he declines to answer .
`` the profit margin is slightly more than that but i do n't have that information .
it is cost effective .
customers do n't pay below cost but it is a competitive market , '' he says .

documents.title: asia markets close higher
text: diverting away from the energy hearing for a moment to give the asian markets close .
asian markets closed pretty much as we were at the lunchtime update .
most of the region 's main markets finsihed higher - dragged up by monday 's wall street gains .
shares in sydney and shanghai added 0.6 % and hong kong got a 0.8 % boost .
but asia 's biggest bourse was an exception , with japan 's nikkei down 0.2 % at 22,868 .

documents.title: electricity cap debated
text: the department for business , energy and industrial strategy committee is hearing from energy bosses about the state of the market .
it is the pre-legislative scrutiny of the draft domestic gas and electricity ( tariff cap ) bill .
the secretary of state , greg clark , is on record as saying he had n't switched as has n't the time to change suppliers .

documents.title: london market update
text: shares - still positive .
the ftse 100 share index is 19 points higher at 7,556 .
the pound is down - a touch - against the dollar .
actually , it 's barely changed .
off 0.08 % at $ 1.3371 , while it is down 0.25 % against the euro at €1.133..
well , it is winding down for christmas .

documents.title: power of the grey pound
text: the ons has come up with a new measure which shows living costs for different households compared to income .
for example , between 2006 and 2016 the costs facing retired households grew by 32 % while their incomes rose by 49 % .
over the same period , the costs facing non-retired households grew by 27 % - while their incomes rose by 26 % .

documents.title: toy shops must be 'an experience '
text: toyologist peter jenkinson believes that toys r us has a future - if it can restructure the business .
he tells bbc radio 5 live : `` there are stores i 've been to recently in the last month that have really started to up their game , they have a very decent offering .
`` the uk toy industry is behind them and really wants to see them surviving .
the uk toy industry is there , there 's money up for grabs and toys r us can definitely be a significant part of it . ''
mr jenkinson acknowledges that online shopping is taking market share from the high street .
`` but still , the trip out to the toy shop is an experience that is starting to come back into fashion therefore i think toys r us could be very placed to take advantage of that , '' he says .

documents.title: german businesses 'full of festive cheer '
text: german business confidence fell unexpectedly in december , after hitting an all-time high in the previous month .

the well-watched ifo survey showed its business climate index , based on a monthly survey of some 7,000 firms , nudge down to 117.2 from 117.6 in november ( an upward revision ) - the highest on record .
but , business morale remains on a relatively high level , ifo chief clemens fuest said .
`` german businesses are full of festive spirits , '' he tells reuters .

documents.title: stores weigh on toys r us
text: are toys r us 's problems specific to the company or are there wider issues in the toy market ?
`` i think at the present time , it is specific to toys r us , '' says toyologist peter jenkinson .
`` last year , the toy industry in the uk was in absolutely rude health , breaking all records and hitting almost £ 3.5bn . ''
he tells radio 5 live : `` i think toys r us does suffer .
it has some very big stores in prime locations .
its rent have started to go up .
its in-store activity has been left wanting a little bit compared to other toy retailers who are really starting to up their game because they see the strength of the uk toy industry . ''

documents.title: companies ' naughty step
text: uk-listed companies with chunky enough numbers of unhappy shareholders will be listed on a register from now on .
the register names those who have seen at least 20 % of shareholders vote against a resolution .
there are 143 names on the list out of 640 - more than one in five .
they include sports direct , sky and wpp .
main reason for unhappiness is excessive pay .
the list is compiled by the investment association - an asset management lobby group whose members control £ 6.9 trillion of assets - has launched a public register of such companies .
it is hoped this `` name and shame '' will improve behaviour .

documents.title: universal buys legendary label ztt
text: the record label behind frankie goes to hollywood , grace jones ( art of noise and madness has been bought by universal music .
universal is buying ztt , stiff records and publisher perfect songs .
ztt was set-up in 1983 by legendary producer trevor horn - the man behind the buggles ' 1980 classic video killed the radio star - with businesswoman jill sinclair and journalist paul morley .
mr horn later acquired stiff records .
ztt and stiff are responsible for the some of the best-selling records of the 1970s and 1980s by artists including the pogues , kirsty maccoll and ian dury .

lucian grainge , chief executive of universal musi , tells the guardian : `` stiff and ztt are truly unique and iconic labels that captured the zeitgeist of their generation and experienced great commercial success , whilst influencing contemporary music entirely on their own terms . ''

documents.title: artists fight back
text: token dj

documents.title: old mutual leads ftse risers
text: the ftse 100 has opened 0.24 % ahead .
old mutual leads the risers after selling-off its wealth business for £ 600m to private equity firm ta associates .
its shares rose 3.8 % .
south african hospital group mediclinic international is the morning 's biggest loser so far , falling 2.1 % .
the ftse 250 is up 0.35 % .
the pound has barely moved against the dollar , up 0.07 % at $ 1.33910 .
sterling is down 0.11 % on the euro at €1.13470 .

documents.title: crunch time for lse chairman
text: will the chairman of the london stock exchange survive the day ?
there 's a gathering wind that he might well .

activist hedge fund manager tci fund management , run by sir christopher hohn , wants donald brydon out of his chairman 's post because of his handling of the succession of xavier rolet , the lse 's former chief executive .
the meeting is being held at 12.00pm today .
a series of heavyweight investors have come out in favour of mr brydon .
jane foley , strategist at rabobank , tells today : `` what we 're hearing from some of the investors it is difficult to lose the chief executive and the chair at the same time . ''

documents.title: shall i compare thee to a microprocessor ?
text: there is clearly an audience for the international congress on love and sex with robots .
and it needs to be an ardent one .
in order to find where the convention is being held , attendees have to decipher a poem .
is this some sort of knight 's quest , complete with ye olde riddle ?
no , say the organisers , it is `` because of security concerns '' .
`` we will send a poem with the location encrypted in it .
please read the poem carefully to decode the location . ''
so , dear reader , we 'd like to hear from you .
what kind of poem would you write ?
send your suggestions to bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: spot the difference
text: so , with ryanair taking baby steps towards recognising its pilot unions is this a sign it is becoming more like ba ?
chris tarry , independent aviation analyst , tells the bbc 's today programme : `` ba has been moving down the curve and ryanair has been moving up the curve .
its policy is to move to more principal airports and move upmarket .
there is convergence . ''

it is worth remembering that part of that convergence is ba 's own less-than cosy relationship with unions in recent years , with bitter long-running strikes and deep changes to working practices in short-haul operations .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: old mutual sells off wealth division
text: old mutual is selling its uk wealth business to private equity firm ta associates for £ 600m .
the business is run by veteran fund manager richard buxton who will stay with the company along with the management team .
it has £ 25.7bn in assets under management .

documents.title: toys r us on the brink
text: toys r us 's american owner is in deep trouble .
it 's in chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the us .
that puts its uk arm with its 106 stores in jeopardy .
there is a rescue plan but the pension protection fund ( ppf ) needs to approve it and , before it does , it wants £ 9m injected into the company to look after pensioners current and future .

it 's a moral dilemma , retail veteran richard hyman tells the today programme : `` we may see a bit of a first here , the ppf actually puts a business out of business in order to protect its current and past employees . ''
he says modern toy retailing is a tough business indeed , christmas is key but these days there is heavy discounting going on , and it is hard to compete .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: boeing and bombardier clash
text: boeing and bombardier set out defence in trade row
and boeing does n't ?
in quebec : je me souviens ''
boeing

documents.title: gocompare buys myvouchercodes
text: a cacophony of capital letter strewn company names kicks off the news that the price comparison website gocompare is taking over the discount code compiler myvouchercodes .
these discount babies are worth £ 36.5m in cash .
what does it do , you cry ?
it works with retailers - including boots , marks & spencer , and restaurants harvester and strada - and tells you what they 're offering off their products today .
it has eight million subscribers .
the chief executive of gocompare , matthew crummack , says : `` we are making strong progress towards our ambition to become the 'go-to ' place for savvy savers . ''

documents.title: trouble brews for toys r us
text: the fate of toys r us is still in the balance as more than 3,000 staff wait to hear if it will go into administration or manage to attract a rescue deal .
the pensions protection fund is asking the troubled company for £ 9m to safeguard the benefits contained in the fund .
jane foley , strategist at rabobank , tells the today programme : `` there is a programme potentially in place by toys r us .
if they allowed this route they could lose a smaller number - 800 jobs - but the pensions regulator is asking it to pay this money '' and , she says , that will push it in to collapse .
toys r us has been in the uk since 1985 .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bhp billiton takes stance on coal
text: anglo-australian mining giant bhp billiton is planning to quit a major industry group in a row over global warming .
bhp said it believed climate change had to be tackled by reducing emissions and using more renewable energy .
but the world coal association - of which the miner is a key member - prefers cleaner coal technology instead and is in favour of scrapping a so-called clean energy target .
bhp said it would also review its membership of the us chamber of commerce over the issue .

documents.title: the real target of europe 's tax probe
text: is the european commission 's tax investigation of ikea about the swedish furniture group or really about the netherlands ?
tax expert mohammed amin tells wake up to money : `` it 's the dutch authorities .

the key principal here is that with the european single union market , the european union as a whole is very concerned to ensure that no individual country gives unfair deals or unfair subsidies to companies established in its territory . ''
he adds : `` and there 's always a temptation for governments to try and attract jobs into a country by either giving cash subsidies or sweetheart tax deals .
`` the european union wants a level playing field so that the netherlands does n't do something special for one company that it does n't do for all other companies . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: taking on goliath
text: margrethe vestager , the european commissioner for competition , has now trained her sights on ikea , and its tax arrangements with the netherlands .
she told the bbc : `` sometimes when i get a little nervous i think about the 500 million europeans who have given the commission these powers .
`` and when you think about 500 million people , and working on their behalf , then you do n't feel small any more . ''

documents.title: hell freezes over at ryanair
text: only in september michael o'leary , ryanair 's chief executive , said hell would freeze over before the company recognised trade unions .
hell has apparently frozen over - possibly because of strikes planned next week - and ryanair 's continued problems with flight cancellations as it is going to meet an irish trade union today .
it 's part of its move to , in future , recognise trade unions .
why the sudden change of heart ?

chris tarry , independent aviation analyst , tells the today programme he never thought it would happen , but : `` times change , and after what we 've seen with the difficulties with the rostering , the balance might have shifted slightly .
it is reasonable and sensible . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asian markets rally after wall street rise
text: after wall street set new records on monday , most asian markets followed the trend with gains in tuesday morning trading .
hong kong added 0.7 % , shanghai put on 0.4 % while australia 's benchmark index climbed 0.6 % .
but by lunchtime japan 's nikkei index was pretty flat at 22,905 points as construction shares weighed on the market .

documents.title: retailers remember - wacd
text: if black friday is potentially such a conundrum , why do shops continue to take part ?
retail economics ' chief executive richard lim says : `` it is all about competitive advantage over your competitors in the retail market . ''
hovering like spectre over retailers is amazon which , in this most recent black friday trading period , took 25 % of all customer traffic .
mr lim says that key for retailers trying to take on the online behemoth is wacd - or what amazon ca n't do .
he says that means companies finding ways to make shopping with them a better experience than simply going online to amazon .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: black friday casts pall over retailers
text: black friday is n't all it is cracked up to be for retailers - many of whom are holding sales before the usual boxing day jamboree .
richard lim , chief executive of retail economics , tells wake up to money that promotional activity is higher before this christmas compared to other years .
as well as economic fundamentals , such as high inflation and poor wage growth , mr lim says : `` retailers are still trying to work out what black friday means for them . ''
`` it is not living to expectations '' , he says , adding that retailers have been left grappling with excess stock following the period .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to business live .

it is an important day for steinhoff , the south african owner of poundland , whose investors will decide whether to support the business - whose chief executive stepped down following accounting irregularities - or sell off its assets .
today is also d-day for the london stock exchange 's donald brydon who will face a vote on whether he will keep his job as chairman .
however , with a number of shareholders throwing their weight behind him , it looks unlikely mr brydon will be going anywhere .
as always , we 'd love to hear from you .
email us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
